text: when we announced that we were coming to
Florida with no plans and no
reservations we got lots of warnings
that there would be no campsite
availability and that there was no wild
camping in Florida well that's just not
true
we don't like to plan because it doesn't
leave any room for spontaneity which
means if we want to do something else or
go somewhere else we can't if we've
already got a bunch of reservations so
it's just not our style of travel on our
way into Florida I was looking for BLM
or National Forest and I did find a lot
but what I did find was a very cool
state-run organization called the
Florida Water Management and they have
places like this which is the Hickory
hammock Wildlife Management Area it's
free camping it's dispersed camping and
it's kind of awesome we've stayed at
recreation sites like this all
throughout the state some of them are
first come first serve others you
actually do have to make a reservation
but you just go online you fill out a
little request and they send you a
permit and it's all free so let me show
you around each of the recreation sites
we've been to have had hiking trails
biking equestrian or all of the above
and they've all been lovely like this
one some of our best wildlife encounters
have also been at these recreation sites
at our last spot we met an alligator at
the fishing pond that was almost a
little too friendly and curious and here
at this location there are armadillos
running around and rooting around all
over the place and we also have some
very cute fuzzy barn owls the really
crazy part is they have amenities not
all of them but some of them the one
we're at has trash recycling they have
fresh water and OH
composting toilets in an outside shower
not too shabby for free of course this
is still Florida and even though it's
winter it can still get very hot and
very humid and there are still a lot of
bugs but as long as you're willing to be
sometimes uncomfortable it's definitely
well worth it to be out here one thing
to know is that the Florida Water
Management is bro
get up into different regions so in our
post on our website I have all of the
different links to the different regions
and I've tried to give you a few tips on
finding the different recreation areas
there are definitely plenty of them and
they are worth checking out if you plan
on camping in Florida so if you're non
planners like us and you want to camp in
the winter in Florida it can totally be
done so don't listen to the naysayers
don't forget to check out our post for
additional pictures on places we've
stayed and where all this great camping
is see you on the road you come
you
